instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message:
No spill.
Has 1.8V on vcore.
.850 on gfx vcore.
0V on <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>
3.4V on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>
won't respond to PRAM with internal or external keyboard.
Tested with known-good screen.
No lights on USB keyboard or USB drive.

Not sure what's left to look for.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: If it definitely chimes, inspect inductor near LCD connector for damage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: It's clean. Nothing damaged. The whole board is spotless. The one-chime thing is weird. PRAM reset doesn't work, no lights on USB peripherals. But the CPU is apparently working enough to turn on and chime once.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: Voltage present on pins 28-30 of LCD connector? If not, is <SIGNAL>LCD_5V_EN</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: There's definitely something deeper happening with this. 0V on <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>LCD_5V_EN</SIGNAL> is at 0V. The fact that it chimes once but won't let me do a PRAM reset is really odd. I've tried with multiple setups to do a PRAM reset and I can't get it to happen. SMC reset works. I've seen this happen many times where a PRAM reset would get it going again and get the screen to turn on, but not necessarily where the computer chimes initially. Not sure what's happening.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: Tried a new BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: I haven't touched it. It doesn't seem like I'm getting that far in the process so I'm tying to rule everything else out first. I feel like it's failing before the BIOS would have an effect. It doesn't appear to be entering the boot stage at all. Not really sure though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message:
If it chimes, it's reaching the BIOS stage. Does it chime and PRAM reset with LCD disconnected by chance?

If no physical damage, I'd try a new BIOS. Don't just clean the ME on the same BIOS, use an entirely new BIOS.

edited for clarification.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message:
Is there real chime, or just a beep?
Let us know any change after BIOS done.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: Ok, I switched the bios chip out from another 00163. I have the normal flash of the lights on the USB keyboard now, but still can't do a PRAM reset. With or without screen attached. No video with screen attached. If I put the original chip back on I get the chime (actual chime) again 1 time but no flash of the keyboard lights.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: That's because you just swapped the chips...you did not load a known-good BIOS with FSYS & $SVS pulled from original file.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: It should still perform a basic boot sequence, and allow for tasks like PRAM. I'm just trying to get to that stage at this point. I want to first find out if it's the chip or something else on the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message:
Nope, not necessarily. You're assuming that. I've seen several instances where a unit will NOT PRAM reset, and the issue was a bad BIOS. I've also seen a million cases where a BIOS prevents a chime at all; or allows a chime but no other boot progress; or a chime and partial boot; or a chime, partial boot and boot to SSD but not USB; or a chime and internet recovery, but no boot to SSD or USB; or a chime and boot but no trackpad/keyboard functionality. The symptoms are not set in stone when it comes to a corrupt/damaged/bad BIOS. There definitely is absolutely no guarantee that a board will chime if you simply swap another BIOS chip over to it; this is ESPECIALLY true for the 2015+ models...they just don't behave the same way as older models. They also don't always like a "clean" ME...a vast majority of the time they will only work (chime, boot) with their [U][B]original[/B][/U] ME region. Cleaning it kills boot a vast majority of the time.

You're going to drive yourself crazy until you do a proper BIOS test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: Ok, got it. I'm not sure what the FSYS & $SVS is but I pulled the krid-area and hwc-area information from the original chip and put in on the new chip. Reading and writing was smooth. No change. The new chip has no chime and no boot. Not sure if there's something else I could do with that but that's the extent of my understanding. So to recap, the original chip would chime but have no boot and no led flash on the external keyboard. The new chip has no chime or boot, but does have an led flash on the keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: Tried the new bios file. No change. It acts like the other new bios files. It has the LED flash on the keyboard (original one didn't) and has no chime (original one did chime once).  It doesn't respond to PRAM reset. Neither bios has ever allowed a PRAM reset.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message:
Did you try another keyboard?
Test USB activity with USB OSX pendrive; if LED flashes you'll be sure there is activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message:
Are you 100% positively sure this board did not have a spill? Inspect CPU power supplies and regulator/controller IC very well, and all surrounding caps. Even if just a single drop or sign of residue, then that's enough. I am still not convinced this isn't a BIOS issue (one of your original reads could have been corrupt/bad, original ME damaged and none of the successive ones good/bootable with board, etc), but it could be a damaged CPU.

Board may have been dropped as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message:
Tried multiple keyboards. Won't respond to PRAM reset. Tried USB flash drive. The light comes on and stays on. No activity, just a constant light. I've never seen that one before.

Can never be 100% sure, but there is no sign of a spill that I can find. I've combed over it exhaustively. Can't find anything that looks damaged in any way.

• Original bios: chimes once only. no usb light flash at all
• New bios chip: no chime. has usb light, but no actual activity
• Repaired bios with original ME and serial: no chime. has usb light, but no actual activity (I tried two different chips just to be sure.)

Not sure what else to do with this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no video
threads.message: Reflow GPU and see if anything change...
